io.smudgr.engine.alg.op

Class Operation

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.smudgr.engine.param.Parametric
      • io.smudgr.engine.alg.AlgorithmComponent
        • io.smudgr.engine.alg.op.Operation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProjectItem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChannelBleed, ChannelCrush, ChannelDrift, DataBend, HSVLModifier, Marbeler, PixelShift, PixelSort, RainbowBend, Smear, SourceMixer, SpectralShift

    public abstract class Operation
extends AlgorithmComponent
    The Operation abstract class is an AlgorithmComponent that defines behavior for executing a pixel manipulation algorithm. Pixels are passed as a Frame object that is operated on directly.

      • execute

        public abstract void execute(Frame img)
        Implementations of the execute(Frame) method create a visual manipulation using the given Frame. Implementors are currently responsible for only acting on the parent Algorithm set of selected pixels.

        While copies of the given Frame may be created for computational purposes, the resulting frame should be stored in the Frame instance passed into this method.

        Parameters:
        img - Frame
        See Also:
        Algorithm.getSelectedPixels()
